fields.text:
Keep Your House Clean with Our Scrubbers, Sponges & More

Our broad range of products combine ergonomic design with innovative technologies that work together to deliver superior cleaning power. Our texture changing non-toxic and scratch-free smiling scrubbers are the smart solution for kitchen and bathroom cleaning. Odor resistance and dual-use designs are perfect for delicate applications as well as heavy-duty jobs. Eraser Daddy brightens the surfaces around your home in seconds while the Scrub Daisy Dishwand System thoroughly cleans anything from baking sheets to baby bottles thanks to uniquely shaped interchangeable heads. Let the Scrub Daddy family handle any cleaning job around your home.

fields.description:
Clean Like A Pro

The Smiling Scrubbers are our most recognizable cleaning tools. Yes the face
is cute but there happens to also be legitimate reasons behind our iconic
shape. Measuring in at over 1 ½ inches thick, Scrub Daddy’s unique size
cleans the sides and depths of your containers simultaneously. His round
shape is ergonomic, offering comfort and thorough cleaning on items like
cups, bowls, glasses, and pots. His eyes hold onto your fingers to keep them
out of the way- an especially helpful feature to those with limited dexterity.
And how could we forget that contagious grin? Effortlessly clean your kitchen
utensils with a quick swipe.
fields.title:
The Smiling
Scrubbers

fields.description:
Versatile Tools For Every Room

Our exclusive materials have taken the form of all your must-have cleaning tools. Time to upgrade your game! If you’re looking for a multifunctional scrubber that delivers the most bang for your buck, check out Big Daddy. Love how erasers clean but hate how fast they fall apart? Eraser Daddy is backed with FlexTexture® foam to reduce premature wear. Say goodbye to sponges that smell with odor-resistant Sponge Daddy or scour pads that tear with durable Scour Daddy. We’ve got something for everyone, every surface, from light to heavy duty cleaning jobs.
fields.title:
Sponges / Erasers /
Scouring & More

fields.description:
This is the last dishwand you will ever need to purchase. To make sure of it, Scrub Daddy honors an unconditional lifetime guarantee on all non-replaceable Scrub Daisy parts. In exchange for the damaged/malfunctioning part, Scrub Daddy will issue a complimentary replacement. This guarantee does not apply to the individual cleaning heads which are replaceable and consumable. Please call 844-35-SCRUB for details.

Ultimate Dishwand, Ultimate Clean

Daisy is much more than a kitchen scrub brush. She’s an entire system made from non-toxic, scratch-free, odor and stain resisting materials! Comprised of 7+ coordinating parts, you can keep it simple or build an entire bouquet. An updated design features a cap made for better grip and seal as well as a deeper drain in the base to provide better drainage. Daisy has uniquely shaped interchangeable heads so you’re sure to have the perfect tool for every job (including baby bottles!). A soap dispensing handle, built-in scraper and flexible core are a few reasons the Scrub Daisy is unlike any dishwand you’ve ever used.
fields.title:
Scrub Daisy
Dishwand System

fields.description:
Happy To Help Accessories

The products in this collection are life savers! Most people don’t prefer a cluttered sink but have a hard time stowing their favorite products out of sight (and reach). Our sink caddies, Daddy Caddy and Sponge Caddy, are the perfect kitchen sink organizers for on-the-spot and out-of-the-way storage. Scrub Daddy accessories can even help with your technological woes. Dirty cell phone screens no longer have to be remedied by wiping your device down your pant leg… Screen Daddy cleans your screen quickly and sticks directly to your case so he’s there when your next selfie calls. Try him on eyeglasses, tablets, compact mirrors… anywhere there’s a smear or smudge!

fields.title: What kind of cleaner should I use with my scrubber?
fields.text: Our unique foam can remove many stains and debris with water alone, minimizing the need for harsh cleaning agents. Try baking soda, vinegar or mild dish soap for common household cleaning.

fields.title: What kind of cleaner should I use with my eraser?
fields.text: Do not use chlorine bleach or household cleaners with your Eraser Daddy. Water is all you need!

fields.title: Should I use cleaner with my Screen Daddy?
fields.text: Screen Daddy works very well dry. You may, however, add regular glass cleaner.

fields.title: What is Screen Daddy made out of?
fields.text: Screen Daddy is made from microfiber on the front and a silicone based adhesive on its back.

fields.title: Is Scrub Daddy tested on animals?
fields.text: No.

fields.title: What is Scrub Daddy made from?
fields.text: Scrub Daddy is made from a highly engineered polymer foam called FlexTexture® that is exclusive to our brand.

fields.title: What is FlexTexture®?
fields.text: FlexTexture® is a highly engineered polymer foam. It's scratch-free on over a dozen different surfaces, changes texture based on water temperature, resists odors for 8 weeks, is non-toxic, BPA and latex free.

fields.title: What is ResoFoam®?
fields.text: ResoFoam® is a highly engineered foam that is exclusive to our brand. Unlike traditional cellulose, it remains velvety soft when dry and resists stains and odors. The material is also suds generating and 6x more absorbent than the leading sponge brand.

fields.title: What is PowErase®?
fields.text: PowErase® is a water activated foam-like material that is exclusive to our brand. It is embossed and heat compressed for durability.

fields.title: Do your products contain latex?
fields.text: Scrub Daddy products are latex free.

fields.title: Do your products contain BPA?
fields.text: Scrub Daddy products are BPA free.

fields.title: Is Scrub Daddy toxic?
fields.text: FlexTexture® and ResoFoam® are non-toxic but not tested for consumption. As with any product a young child or animal may be exposed to, adult supervision is highly recommended.

fields.title: Are Scrub Daddy products recyclable?
fields.text: No.

fields.title: Is Scrub Daddy biodegradable?
fields.text: Test results pending.

fields.title: Are Scrub Daddy products kosher certified?
fields.text: Our products are not kosher certified but absolutely no aspect of their manufacturing processes deem them ineligible to be.

fields.title: When should I use Scrub Daddy firm versus soft?
fields.text: For messes in need of extra scrubbing power, like burnt or sticky debris, a firm texture is best. Use soft for lighter cleaning jobs or when you need absorbency and soap suds.

fields.title: How do I change the texture of my Scrub Daddy?
fields.text: Tap water is all you need. FlexTexture® is firm in cold water and soft in warm water.

fields.title: Why is my scrubber not getting firm under cold water?
fields.text: Depending on the time of year and location, some faucets may not produce water cold enough to drastically change Scrub Daddy's texture. To test this, saturate your scrubber with water and place in the freezer for a few minutes. If no change is noticeable, please call 844-35-SCRUB for help.

fields.title: How do I clean my Scrub Daddy?
fields.text: Hold under warm running water and massage gently. Feel free to add a mild soap if needed.

fields.title: How do I make my Screen Daddy sticky again?
fields.text: To reactivate Screen Daddy’s adhesive backing, wet under running water. Let air dry or pat with a lint free cloth.

fields.title: My Screen Daddy isn't sticky.
fields.text: Upon opening, make sure to discard the protective paper backing.

fields.title: Is Scrub Daddy top rack dishwasher safe?
fields.text: Yes, all of our products are top rack dishwasher safe with the exception of Eraser Daddy and Screen Daddy.

fields.title: How can I sanitize my Scrub Daddy?
fields.text: Dampen and microwave for no longer than 60 seconds to sanitize.

fields.title: Why doesn’t my Scrub Daddy absorb water?
fields.text: Scrub Daddy is a scrubber, not a sponge! He will not absorb very much water, especially when cold. Try Scrub Mommy or Sponge Daddy for this instead.

fields.title: Why doesn’t my Scour Daddy absorb water?
fields.text: Scour Daddy is a scour pad, not a sponge! He will not absorb very much water, especially when cold. Try Scrub Mommy or Sponge Daddy for this instead.

fields.title: Will my Scrub Daddy hold odors?
fields.text: FlexTexture® foam is lab tested to not hold odors for up to 8 weeks under normal conditions.

fields.title: My Sponge Daddy smells.
fields.text: Unlike the scrubby FlexTexture® side, ResoFoam® is only odor resistant. For best results, we recommend squeezing dry after use and storing in an open holder. Sponge Daddy is also top rack dishwasher safe.

fields.title: My Scrub Mommy smells.
fields.text: Unlike the scrubby FlexTexture® side, ResoFoam® is only odor resistant. For best results, we recommend squeezing dry after use and storing in an open holder. Scrub Mommy is also top rack dishwasher safe.

fields.title: How long is Sponge Daddy supposed to last?
fields.text: 2 weeks is considered the normal lifespan for this product, however, the number will vary depending upon individual use.

fields.title: Will my Sponge Daddy hold odors?
fields.text: Sponge Daddy's soft ResoFoam® side is odor resistant and can develop an odor over time.

fields.title: Will my Scrub Mommy hold odors?
fields.text: Scrub Mommy's soft ResoFoam® side is odor resistant and can develop an odor over time.

fields.title: What surfaces can I use my Scrub Daddy on?
fields.text: In independent lab tests Scrub Daddy did not scratch the following surfaces: Acrylic, Aluminum, Car Exterior paint, Seasoned Cast Iron, Ceramic, Chrome, Copper, Crystal, Enamel, Fiberglass, Glass, Granite, Leather, Limestone, Marble, Non-stick Coatings, Oil Rubbed Bronze, Plastic, Porcelain, Soapstone, Stainless Steel, Travertine, Vinyl, Wood. If you have any concerns we recommend testing a small and inconspicuous area first.

fields.title: What surfaces can I use my Eraser Daddy on?
fields.text: Eraser Daddy should be used to spot clean hard surfaces such as walls, baseboards, switch plates and white rubber sneaker gums. The water activated PowErase® side could scratch some surfaces so be sure to always test a small and inconspicuous area first. Avoid use on soft plastics, non-stick coatings, finished or unfinished wood, automobile finishes, stainless steel, copper, leather, and bare skin. After using on a surface that may contain food, rinse surface thoroughly to remove any residue.

fields.title: What surfaces are safe to clean with Screen Daddy?
fields.text: Screen Daddy is made from microfiber and is safe to use on any glass surface.

fields.title: How long should Scrub Daddy last?
fields.text: Like any soft material, FlexTexture® will deteriorate over time with use. Rough surfaces or harsh chemicals will erode the foam faster than with gentle use. For more help please contact our team by calling 844-35-SCRUB.

fields.title: How long should Eraser Daddy last?
fields.text: Eraser Daddy's PowErase® side will deteriorate as it is used. For maximum service life, use the FlexTexture® side first.

fields.title: How long will the lemon scent last?
fields.text: Scent will gradually dissipate over time.

fields.title: What is the difference between Heavy Duty and Big Daddy?
fields.text: There isn't one! This is the same product, just rebranded.

fields.title: What is the difference between Scrub Daddy and Scrub Mommy?
fields.text: These products are identical in shape but differ in materials. Scrub Daddy is made entirely of FlexTexture® whereas Scrub Mommy is dual-sided; half FlexTexture® scrubber, half ResoFoam® sponge.

fields.title: What is the difference between Sponge Daddy and Scrub Mommy?
fields.text: These products are made from the same materials, the only difference is their shape! Sponge Daddy is rectangular and Scrub Mommy is our signature smile face.

fields.title: Are the different colors for certain things?
fields.text: Only if you want them to be! Multiple colors make color-coding easier when using several in your home.

fields.title: Can I use Scrub Daddy to exfoliate?
fields.text: Yes! Our FlexTexture® foam was originally designed to scrub hands. But keep in mind it can be abrasive in cold water. We recommend starting with warm water for a softer texture and reducing the temperature gradually if needed.

fields.title: Can I cut my Scrub Daddy?
fields.text: Yes. Cutting should only be performed by adults.

fields.title: Can I cut my Big Daddy?
fields.text: Yes. Use a serrated knife to customize size and shape. Cutting should only be performed by adults.

fields.title: Does the sponge have soap in it?
fields.text: None of our products contain detergents of any kind.

fields.title: Is Scrub Daddy safe to use on car paint?
fields.text: Yes. FlexTexture® has been independently lab tested scratch-free on car exterior paint. Hard foreign debris could, however, cause damage so be sure to rinse the surface first.

fields.title: My spare Daisy heads won't stay on the Valet.
fields.text: For a secure hold, make sure the prongs located inside the scrubbing head's collar are aligned with the Valet's arm during placement.

fields.title: Soap isn't coming out of the Daisy head.
fields.text: Aim the wand downward and press the leaf button several times. It may take up to 60 seconds for the soap to travel into the scrubbing head on first fill. If there is still no soap, please contact our team by emailing support@scrubdaddy.com or call toll free by dialing 844-35-SCRUB.

fields.title: My Daisy base won’t stay suctioned to the counter top.
fields.text: For best results, clean and dry both surfaces. Press firmly to engage the suction cup making sure there is no overhang.

fields.title: My Scrub Daisy head fell off in use.
fields.text: Make sure the head's collar has been turned far enough to lock. You should feel a soft 'click' when it is secured and see no visible gap between the collar and wand.

fields.title: Soap is leaking out of my Scrub Daisy wand.
fields.text: Please contact our team by emailing support@scrubdaddy.com or call toll free by dialing 844-35-SCRUB.

fields.title: How do you change the Daisy head?
fields.text: To remove the scrubbing head from the wand, use two fingers to firmly grip its collar and rotate counter clockwise.

fields.title: How do I clean my Scrub Daisy?
fields.text: All components of the Scrub Daisy Dishwand System are top rack dishwasher safe. Hand washing is recommended for daily upkeep.

fields.title: My Scrub Daisy is dripping on my counter top.
fields.text: For best results, squeeze out excess water before storing. Also, make sure the base's drain is aimed into your sink and seated at the edge of your counter.

fields.title: Do you sell replacement heads for the Daisy?
fields.text: Yes. Replacement heads are available through our online Smile Shop, QVC and Bed Bath & Beyond. See our Where to Buy page for more information.

fields.title: What can I do with my old Scrub Daddy?
fields.text: Relocate old products to the garage, bathroom, or backyard for a second life of cleaning.

fields.title: The Caddy won't stay suctioned to my sink.
fields.text: In order to best assist you with this, please contact our team by emailing support@scrubdaddy.com or call toll free by dialing 844-35-SCRUB.

fields.title: How long will each Daisy head last?
fields.text: Roughly 2 months under normal conditions. Lifespan will unavoidably vary per household depending upon use.

fields.title: Does the Hyacinth head fit into baby bottles?
fields.text: Yes.

fields.title: Does the Hyacinth head fit into S'well bottles?
fields.text: Yes.

fields.title: Can Scrub Daddy be used with bleach?
fields.text: For maximum service life, we recommend avoiding harsh chemicals with our products.

fields.title: What is the Valet made of?
fields.text: Stainless steel.

fields.title: What is the Caddy made of?
fields.text: Our Caddies are made of plastic.

fields.title: What are Big Daddy's dimensions?
fields.text: 3"x3"x5".

fields.title: What was your deal on Shark Tank?
fields.text: Lori Greiner secured the winning deal offering $200,000 for a 20% stake. For more company history, see our About Us page!

fields.title: What shark invested in you?
fields.text: Lori Greiner.

fields.title: Where is the Scrub Daddy headquarters?
fields.text: Folcroft Pennsylvania.

fields.title: Can I get stock in your company?
fields.text: Scrub Daddy is a privately owned company.

fields.title: Where can I buy your products?
fields.text: For retailer information, please see our Where to Buy page.

fields.title: Are you going to make a mop?
fields.text: Yes! It is currently in the works.

fields.title: Are you going to make a toilet brush?
fields.text: Yes! It is currently in the works.

fields.title: When were you on shark tank?
fields.text: Our episode aired on October 25, 2012. For more company history, see our About Us page!

fields.title: How can I get a t-shirt?
fields.text: Visit our Smile Shop for Scrub Daddy merchandise.

fields.title: What is the point of the smile face?
fields.text: The smile face is ergonomic and fully functional. Place two fingers in Scrub Daddy's eyes to reach the bottom of containers while also cleaning its sides. His mouth cleans both sides of utensils at the same time!

fields.title: How can I get more soap to come out of my Scrub Daisy wand?
fields.text: We recommend diluting all detergent with 50% water for best results.

fields.title: How do I clean my Screen Daddy?
fields.text: Add a drop of mild hand soap and massage under running water. Let air dry or pat with a lint free cloth.

fields.text: Scrub Daddy makes high-performance cleaning products by combining exclusive materials with fun, functional designs. Texture changing scrubbers, smell resistant sponges, scratch-free scour pads are just a few reasons we are                  America's Favorite Sponge® company!

fields.title: Early On
fields.text: Aaron Krause was 37 years old and running an international manufacturing company. An average workday meant tending to paperwork in the front office while also repairing machinery in the back. Dirty hands were a constant annoyance, and over time, so became the only product available to clean them with (a slurry of rocks and lotion known as GOJO). Using his 14 years’ experience making urethane foam buffing pads, Aaron embarked on a mission to invent a more comfortable way to clean his hands.

fields.title: The Hand Scrubber
fields.text: A highly engineered polymer foam proved to be the perfect solution. In fact it worked so well Aaron knew he couldn’t keep it all to himself. He patented the design which was round in shape, grooved on one side, and featured two holes punched out of its center. He began marketing the hand scrubber to body shops where he was met with overwhelming opposition. They felt the product was nonessential and overly priced. Without the support of his target market Aaron had no choice but to surrender the idea, tossing the yellow foam into a box and writing the letters S-C-R-A-P across its side.

fields.title: For Sale
fields.text: By 2007, Multinational conglomerate 3M had their eye on Aaron’s buffing pad company. They acquired it in August of 2008 taking everything. Well, almost everything. A handful of boxes considered to hold no value were left in his possession.

fields.title: A Smile is Born
fields.text: It was fall and the lawn furniture needed cleaning. Aaron starting using a traditional dual-sided sponge but it immediately scratched the paint. He decided to try the old hand scrubbing foam which had been stored away slowly collecting dust. It worked shockingly well and didn’t scratch! As he continued cleaning, Aaron noticed the cold air temperature was causing the foam’s texture to change, becoming firmer. The more rigid consistency delivered an extra oomph of scrubbing power. Each time he then dunked the foam back into the soapy water, it softened and conformed more easily. After the furniture was clean he brought the scrubber in to the kitchen sink. With little effort and some running water, the mucky scrubber looked practically unused sparking its next test subject, the dishes. It was a match made in heaven. A smiling mouth was added to better clean utensils opening the door for another patent.

fields.title: Let’s make it official
fields.text: Later that year, persistent grassroots marketing paid off when a featured article was published in the Philadelphia Inquirer. The write-up caught the eye of an independent broker whose mission, he declared, was to book Scrub Daddy’s first live QVC show. It was at this point Aaron realized Scrub Daddy needed to be its own entity and separated the product and patent IAP. In 2012 Scrub Daddy, Inc. was officially established. Shortly thereafter, Scrub Daddy was the subject of 4 successful on-air QVC shows.

fields.title: Into the Tank
fields.text: Despite having some sales, the smiling scrubber tool still wasn’t able to secure presence in any major retail store. One night while watching ABC’s Shark Tank, Aaron realized partnering with one of the “Sharks” could be the key to opening those retail doors. Backed with newfound TV confidence, he applied to the show. After 3 long months of auditions, filming finally took place in July of 2012. On October 25th of that year, Scrub Daddy premiered on season four, episode seven of the show. Aaron’s infomercial-like presentation grabbed the attention of celebrity “Shark” and prolific inventor, Lori Greiner, who secured the winning deal.

fields.title: New Digs
fields.text: Exposure from national television was colossal and as a result, the company quickly outgrew its rented space. A larger facility was purchased and the crew relocated to its current residence in Folcroft, Pennsylvania. The move fostered even more growth, allowing the development of powerful partnerships with leading retailers such as Bed Bath & Beyond, Wal-Mart, Home Depot, Kroger, Target, QVC, Meijer and many more.

fields.title: Swimming with Sharks
fields.text: In May of that year, ABC aired a 20/20 special entitled “Swimming with Sharks” in which Scrub Daddy was named “Shark Tank’s most successful product to date”. A title which has held true to this day!

fields.title: New Year, New Look
fields.text: Despite sentimental appeal, the Scrub Daddy logo had become dated looking. Meanwhile, the ever expanding product line lacked overall unification. With several new products on deck to debut, a full-on brand makeover was needed. Modernized artwork and a fresh approach to packaging were instated over a 4 month period. The change would signify not only the brands staying power amongst industry leaders, but a seemingly limitless future for the now not-so-underdogs.

fields.title: The Magic Wand
fields.text: The patented Scrub Daisy Dishwand System is the twelfth unique product in the Scrub Daddy family. She (yes, she) serves as a significant milestone for the company due to the sheer complexity of design. The system, which is comprised of seven plus collaborating parts, took 4 long years to move from conception to completion. Scrub Daisy was first offered to customers via home shopping network QVC where she sold out upon her first two airings.

fields.title: Fishwaffle & Mudball
fields.text: Since airing on Shark Tank in 2012, a continuous stream of media opportunities gifted the team by way of episode re-runs, follow ups, national interviews and magazine articles. The time had come, however, to create some original media buzz. And so the decision to develop Scrub Daddy’s first ever commercial was made. Two uniquely lovable scripts multiplied the project which materialized as the Fishwaffle and Mudball videos.

fields.title: Expansion
fields.text: More products (screen cleaners, sponge Caddies, seasonal colors!) and presence in every major US retailer (plus several internationally!) meant it was again necessary to expand headquarters. To do so, they purchased the adjacent building which in turn doubled their footprint to 80,000 sq. feet. To compare, the company first operated within 5,000 sq. ft.
The business, named Dedication to Detail, Inc., specialized in manufacturing foam buffing pads for the automotive industry.
The holes, now recognized as Scrub Daddy’s eyes, were originally meant for 360° finger cleaning. Scrub Daddy’s ridges, or hair, were initially made for cleaning under the users fingernails.
After the sale, Aaron formed a new company called Innovative Accessory Products (IAP) which owned both the patent and scrap material known today as Scrub Daddy.
The name Scrub Daddy came from Aaron’s role as the household dishwasher. A Wharton professor warned him the name was terrible and would never sell.
Before that fateful fall afternoon, the foam now known as FlexTexture® had been untouched for five years.
The Inquirer article was titled “The Daddy of the Scrub Daddy”, a name that’s happily stuck with Aaron since.

Aaron watched every pre-existing episode of Shark Tank notating the common questions, mistakes and successes of previous entrepreneurs. He constructed flow charts using this data to better predict the possible play in conversation between himself and the judges.
Aaron’s actual time in the tank was upwards of 90 heart pounding minutes.
Prior to going on Shark Tank, Scrub Daddy was available in only a handful of local ShopRite stores.
The company colors, a fluorescent orange, blue and yellow, remained the same.
Over the course of those 4 years, the product faced innumerable hurdles ranging from manufacturing complications to multiple aesthetic redesigns.
The singing fish shown in Fishwaffle’s closing scene is a hand operated puppet.
The music featured in the ads was composed exclusively for Scrub Daddy.
Scrub Daddy products are available in Australia, England and Sweden.
The brand has appeared on home shopping networks broadcast in Dubai, Italy and Germany.

fields.header: ABC’s of Clean: Make Your Dirty Stovetop Shine
fields.text:
You’ve finished dinner, washed the pots and pans, and put away the leftovers. Time to relax. Not so fast—you forgot to clean the stove top. In the world of cleaning, we often save the worst for last. It can be a challenge to remove food and grease from the stove, especially when it has been neglected a bit.

Our how-to guide helps make cleaning less of a chore. Cheers to a clean kitchen in record time, thanks to Scrub Daddy!

Depending on what type of stove-top you have these instructions may vary.

How to clean up light stains on your stove top

What You’ll Need:

  • Scrub Daddy sponge
  • Kitchen sink
  • Mild dish soap
  • Microfiber cloth
  • An old rag
  • Glass cleaner

       

Directions:

  1. Set aside any removable grates/knobs.
  2. Saturate your Scrub Daddy completely with cold tap water (the foam should feel firm); quickly move to your stove top.
    Pro Tip: Fight your natural instinct here to wring out the water! It’s the constant contact with the cold that keeps FlexTexture® foam firm, in-turn delivering more scrubbing power.
  3. Add some dish soap to the area you are intending to clean and start scrubbing. Be sure to get the burnt piece of macaroni that missed your mouth earlier.
  4. Once you feel all the debris has lifted, use a rag to soak up the excess water and wipe away the mess.
  5. Finish with a spray of glass cleaner and a clean microfiber towel.
  6. Replace burners. Pat self on back.

How to remove moderate stains from your stove top

What You’ll Need:

  • Scrub Daddy sponge
  • Kitchen sink
  • Baking soda
  • Mild dish soap
  • Microfiber cloth
  • An old rag
  • White vinegar
  • Glass cleaner
  • Spray bottle (optional)

 

     

Directions:

  1. Begin by filling your sink with hot soapy water. Disregard if you have an electric cooktop.
    Pro Tip: Soap containing a degreasing agent is ideal.
  2. While waiting for the sink to fill, saturate your Scrub Daddy with tap water and transfer to freezer.
  3. Remove grates/knobs that can easily be re-assembled; submerge and leave in the sink to soak.
  4. Squirt some dish soap onto your stove top and retrieve your frozen Scrub Daddy. Working in small circular motions, scrub the entire surface. Use an old rag to soak up the excess water.
  5. Next, sprinkle an even layer of baking soda over high traffic areas. Pour (or spray if using a bottle) white vinegar to coat. Watch *in amazement* as it bubbles for 30 seconds.
  6. Use your Scrub Daddy to carefully incorporate the mixture, keeping away from the burners. Let the paste work its magic for about 10 minutes.
    Pro Tip: This happens to be just enough time to enjoy a glass of wine.
  7. OK, break’s over. Now run some warm water over your Scrub Daddy so he becomes soft and flexible. Scrub the entire surface one last time; wipe away the mess with a damp rag.
    Pro Tip: Place your fingers in Scrub Daddy’s eyes to better navigate tight corners.
  8. Finish with a glass cleaner and a clean microfiber towel.
  9. If you have items soaking, drain the water and use your Scrub Daddy to remove any resistant particles.
    Pro Tip: For grates shaped with straight prongs, Scrub Daddy’s mouth delivers a quick 360° cleaning.
fields.note: You’ve finished dinner, washed the pots and pans. Time to relax. Not so fast—you forgot to clean the stovetop.

fields.header: Why You Should Consider Copper Cookware
fields.text:
Contrary to common belief, you don’t have to be the Lindt chocolatier or Julia Child to use and enjoy copper cookware! Anyone looking to upgrade their kitchen collection game should consider investing in just one piece. Here’s why.

Copper Cookware 101

There’s good reason professional chefs have kept copper in their kitchens for hundreds and hundreds of years. It happens to be just as efficient as it is beautiful, conducting heat 5x better than iron and 20x better than stainless steel. High thermal conductivity goes beyond saving you prep-time. Once warm, a copper bottom pan distributes heat much more evenly than a traditional one. If your food has ever fell victim to a ‘hotspot’ you can bet that won’t happen. And because copper is so reactive, cooking takes place at a lower temperature that is also more easily controlled. A good general rule of thumb is to cut the suggested temp in half. Less heat equals less chance of burnt food. Copper cookware is substantial without being difficult to lift like cast iron, it’s durable, corrosion-resistant and even antimicrobial. Yes there is upkeep involved but it’s probably less invasive than you think, more on that below.

Buying Cookware

There are a few things to consider when shopping. The depth of the metal plays a role in its overall quality; too thick or too thin is not good. This is less of a factor if you are buying from a reputable retailer but if you’re not, 2.5mm is considered ideal.

Most copper cookware is lined with a non-reactive metal to help protect you and the copper. The most popular linings are stainless steel and tin, each of which has its own set of pros and cons. Tin is most traditional and does require extra care. Because tin is a soft material it can scratch more easily and will need to be retinned by a tinsmith at some point later in life. To avoid tarnishing, an acidic wash like the one at the end of this article should be used every so often. Stainless is less fussy in terms of maintenance and can withstand higher temperatures, however, it cannot be refinished if it gets damaged and is not non-stick. Similarly to cast iron, this can make it a little tricky to work with until it becomes seasoned.

There are also hybrid variations such as copper bottomed or cored pans- just don’t expect quite the same level of conductivity from them. If you want the real deal, iron handles and all, we recommend our neighbors up north Brooklyn Copper Cookware. Mauviel is another great brand that has been around since 1830 and offers both tin and stainless lined collections. Don’t let the cost of an entire set scare you, just one saucepan is all you need!

Polishing Copper Cookware

For maximum service life, hand wash copper cookware and avoid contact with harsh chemicals such as bleach. Below is a quick, chemical-free way to wash and polish your copper between uses.

The Lemon method

What you’ll need:

  • Scrub Mommy sponge
  • Juice from 1 lemon
  • Microfiber towel

*The acid in the lemon juice is what breaks down the corrosion layer or patina. If you don’t have any on hand, vinegar is an adequate substitute.

How often you should do it: Copper naturally develops a patina over time. To embrace this darkened color, apply the lemon solution only occasionally. If you prefer your copper to shine like a mirror, you’ll want to do this regularly between uses.

Directions:

  1. Hold your Scrub Mommy under warm water until soft. Squeeze out excess water.
  2. Place the item you are going to clean in a sink or a shallow bowl.
  3. Saturate Scrub Mommy’s scrubby FlexTexture® side in lemon juice. Using a circular motion, work in batches until you’ve scrubbed all surfaces.
  4. The results should be immediate! If you need more scrubbing power, add some cold water to your Scrub Mommy and repeat.
  5. Rinse with warm water and dry with a clean microfiber towel.
  6. Optional: to enhance the natural polish of the copper, rub a dab of vegetable oil over its surface.
fields.note: Everything you need to know about this seriously smart metal.

fields.about:
15+ years experience in retail and hardware sales with 50+ lines including cleaning products
27% product revenue increase in over 200+ stores
Product placement in large co-ops such as Ace, True Value, DIB, Orgil, Handy Hardware, McCoy's
Ability to train stores and management on product placement, product knowledge to increase product movement
fields.responsibilities:
	Devise effective territory sales plans and marketing plans for variety of customers
	Develop and utilize marketing strategies resulting in 25-27% growth among 200+ existing clients in the Southwest Territory including but not limited to Texas, Oklahoma, Louisiana, Arkansas, and Nebraska.
	Building impact relationships with independent hardware chains owned and operated by Do It Best, Ace Hardware, True Value, HDW, and Origill
	Customer relations specialist and liaison between independent hardware stores, buyers, distributors and manufactures.
	Hold in store meetings and visits with store owners, other key management and buyers to discuss promotions, early buy programs, and train on product knowledge
	Develop training material and training days for stores to review marketing strategies and how to cross sell and cross merchandise
	Analyze data to locate the most efficient sales methods to increase store revenue by forecasting previous sales plans
	Meet with customers, vendors, and merchandisers to address concerns, offer post-sales support and resolutions
	Discover sales opportunities through a variety of customer research strategies
	Present sales, product and marketing knowledge and training to potential new clients and new stores
	Participate in industry promotional events, retail shows and store events to cultivate customer relationships and keep stores up to date on all products being offered through the company
	Assess sales performance according to national KPIs
	Prepare and submit reports to direct buyers, store managers and owners, manufacturers, and VPs through a variety of internal CRM software
	Product placement with large manufacturers; i.e. Klein Tools, Dorcy, Enforcer/Zep,Generac Generator, Sharkbite, J.B. Weld, WD-40, Passload, First Alert, Yankee Candle, Lutron
	Created on average 20 new Klein Tools destinations and opened on average 10 new Enforcer/Zep accounts  in the last 5 years
	Increased customer retention of a large multi-million dollar client resulting in placement of products not placed in 15 years of company history
	Analyzed competitor sales and customer base to increase traffic to potential and existing clients
	Territory Manager for large store chains such as McCoy’s Hardware, Keith’s Ace Hardware, HDW, Groom and Sons, Nuts and Bolts, and Handy Hardware

fields.about:
I am a very passionate, all-in, focused sales representative, looking to make a difference in a company and expand its products reach. I found Scrub Daddy long before I knew it was a Shark Tank product - actually introduced to the classic yellow sponge by my grandmother (just as she introduced me to my boyfriend of 11 years!). When we were moving to Charleston, SC she said, "this is all you'll need in your new house" and handed me the sponge, and she was right. To date, I've bought and shared your product with people naturally because of how much I personally love the product! ...you would adore my Grams (who lives in Media, PA!) - always right. 

I recently watched an episode of Shark Tank that highlighted Scrub Daddy's success since being on the show and I was surprised to see that the company is based out of Philadelphia, notably Folcroft, PA. I was born in Ridley Park and grew up in Media - attending Penncrest High School, then Villanova and Penn State University. My whole family lives in the Philadelphia suburbs and Scrub Daddy would have been a company I called on when I worked at American Packaging. Your company would have been a dream account! I'd still recommend them as an amazing resource for packaging supplies if you need a knowledgeable contact and better pricing (stretch film, tape, strap, stretch wrap machinery, etc.). Regardless of the availability of jobs at this moment in the southeast, if you are not working with American Packaging, you should, and I would be happy to connect you! The owner is Mark Moses (484) 467-7130. Please extend my recommendation and have your team learn about how his company - another locally owned business - could reduce your costs and make a big difference! 

My dream is to make a difference in a company I am working for and to be able to support myself while doing that. Since moving to South Carolina I haven't found an opportunity that stands up to American Packaging. I work hard for my worth and know that I can impact any company I am a part of, but my struggle in the south has been the value return. I am very comfortable working with a base pay and commission. Full disclosure - for American Packaging I started with a base of $32,500 which never changed. First year I made close to $50,000 and by the time I was relocating I was making $80,000/year. I am striving to get back to this place, beyond and prove that my knowledge of many industries and sales history can substantially impact Scrub Daddy. Having so much family in the area surrounding your headquarters could also allow me to split time between my home in Charleston and Philadelphia as needed.

Thank you for your consideration and please keep me in mind as opportunities become available!
fields.responsibilities:
Use business development techniques to generate new opportunities and strengthen client relationships in order to drive product value

Implement selling structure and design strategies to increase brand awareness

Design and manage website and social media platform (www.dontbsquare.com // @dontbsquaresc) to increase visibility
fields.reason_for_leaving:
Pay structure
Company growth
Looking for an opportunity to impact a company/product in my territory 

There is only space for one previous employer; however, when you look at my resume I was a Sales Representative for American Packaging Distributors Corp. in West Chester, PA for nearly five years before moving to South Carolina. Please contact them for any insight into my selling ability, performance and time with the company. My request to not contact my current employer is because I still work for the company, but I am certain he would provide a strong recommendation in the future.

fields.name: Julianne M Johnston
fields.comments: I use Scrub Daddy in my skin care regimen. It is FANTASTIC at exfoliation!! It gets all the dead skin and traps it, and does not scratch healthy skin. I use it dry for my heels, knees and legs, and warm water for my face, though it is a little bit rough still. I might try Scrub Mommy for my face, lol! Just wanted to let you know how versatile and awesome your product is. I recommend it to EVERYONE! :D

fields.name: Bridget Hancock
fields.comments:
Hi there!  I want to first start by saying that I have been an avid Scrub Daddy user for many years now. I absolutely love your products so when I saw this Scrub Daisy Dishwand Set I just had to have it! I love the vase and all of the different attachments that go with this set. It does make washing dishes much easier. 
However, after using this for only a couple of weeks the "Daisy Head" is already tearing up. I am so very disappointed in this. I am not one to usually send an email complaining about things, but with the very high cost of this set and the high cost of the replacement heads I would have thought that they would last a little bit longer than a couple of weeks. I may be able to understand if I was using this to wash knives and other sharp objects but I do not. I only wash cups, bowls, plates, and other misc items. I have uploaded a few photos of the Daisy Head for you to see some of the areas that are tearing up. I did not take photos of each area that has torn up, only the few areas that seem to be the worst. With all of this being said, I do feel like I should state that the other two heads (The Sunflower and The Hyacinth) seem to be doing ok. "The Hyacinth" is starting to show a little bit of torn areas, but nothing like "The Daisy Head".  
My contact information is below. 
Bridget Hancock
518 Red Valley Road
Remlap, Alabama 35133
USA 
(205) 908-8116
Bhancock1110@outlook.com

fields.name: Jill Parrish
fields.comments:
I am writing on behalf of the Eagle Elementary PTO to request a donation for our Raffle Basket Fundraiser event scheduled for April 17 and 18, 2019, being held in conjunction with the EES Art & Music Festival and Grandparents Day. At this event, typically attended by about 500 community members, we raffle off gift cards, merchandise, and services generously donated by businesses like yours. The event proceeds will help pay for field trips, books for the all-school read, and improvements to the school. 

We would greatly appreciate any donation you can make. Should you make a donation for the raffle baskets, your business will be recognized on raffle displays at the event, as well as in the school newsletter and Facebook page. We will also provide a donation receipt letter with the PTO’s tax exempt ID number for your records, if needed.

If you have any questions or need further information, please contact me at (262) 844-3894 or at ptoeagleelementary@gmail.com.  On behalf of the students, parents, and faculty of Eagle Elementary, thank you for your consideration. 
Sincerely, 


Jill Parrish
Eagle Elementary PTO President

fields.name: Sherry Kowalski
fields.comments:
I am writing on behalf of Pet OverPopulation Prevention (POPP) to request a donation for our silent auction, which we call the POPP Fur Ball, that is scheduled for May 11, 2019. At this event, typically attended by about 600 community members, we auction off gift cards, merchandise, and services generously donated by businesses like yours. The event proceeds are used to provide critical funds to help provide low cost pet spay and neutering assistance to the community to help combat the ongoing needless suffering and death of homeless pets. 

Although POPP’s primary mission is to promote responsible pet ownership by offering low cost spay and neuter clinics, microchip clinics, and educational opportunities, POPP also provides funding for medical services, food, and support for our all-volunteer rescue foster care program. 

We would greatly appreciate any donation you can make. Should you make a donation for the silent auction, your business will be recognized on auction displays at the event as well as in the auction program. Items that qualify for the live auction are listed in a special section of the program and are presented with a slide presentation that can include information about your company, your logo and a detailed description of the item which will be presented by our emcee and auctioneer. We will also provide a donation receipt letter for tax purposes and your records. 

If you have any questions or need further information, please contact me at (509) 308-6858 or at FurBallDonations@gmail.com. On behalf of the Fur Ball Auction Committee, our team of volunteers, and all the pets that have been saved, we thank you for your consideration.

Sincerely, 

Sherry Kowalski

Sherry Kowalski
Silent Auction Chairperson
Pet OverPopulation Prevention
Prevent a Litter ...Spay or Neuter your Critter!!™
5811 W Van Giesen Street
​West Richland, WA 99353/ 509.943.4722
A 501(c) 3, All Volunteer, No-Kill Pet Rescue / EIN 91-1846733
www.popptricities.org

fields.name: Lauren Spirov
fields.comments:
Dear Scrub Daddy,

My name is Lauren and I am reaching out on behalf of Chicago Women's Health Center (CWHC) to ask that you please consider making a donation of dish sponges.

CWHC makes access to affirming health care and health education possible for over 6,000 women, trans people, and young people across Chicago each year. Our services are offered on a sliding scale and no one is turned away based on their ability to pay or insurance status. As a non-profit organization, we rely on support from the Chicago community and like-valued businesses to provide our critically needed services.

Your donation would directly support running our programs and would free up additional resources to help our clients and students. For the cost of 10 dish sponges we will be able to provide two clients with a screen for cervical cancer.

We would be incredibly grateful for any donation you can make. We would also be happy to recognize your support on our social media and provide tax acknowledgement of your gift.

I am happy to send more information about CWHC’s work and proof of our non-profit status. If there is any additional information that would be helpful, please feel free to reply to this email or to call CWHC’s Development Director, A.J. Barks, at 773-935-6126 x229.

Thank you for considering our request!

Lauren

The Western Nevada College Fallon Campus will be hosting its 1st Annual Friends of Western Benefit Fundraiser on Friday, April 5, 2019 at the Fallon Convention Center. This special evening will feature dinner, a raffle, and auction items. We are expecting up to 300 attendees.  

Proceeds from this event are critical to supporting programs at the Western Nevada College Fallon Campus and its rural service areas. Programs include the Rural Nursing Program, transferable degrees, Jump Start/Dual Enrollment, Workforce Development/Career and Technical Education, Community Education, College for Kids, CDL, and INBRE research.   

By donating to our fundraiser, you are helping to ensure that these educational local programs will continue in rural Nevada. Our Foundation tax ID number is 88-0283783. fields.name: Con Christopoulos
fields.comments:
Hi, 
I have invented, patented and sold about four thousand  "Backwashers. " It is a hygiene product, that is 40cm long, 10cm wide and 5mm thick. It is an anti-bacterial, mould resistant, exfoliating scourer, that is glued to a rubber backing, covered in small suction cups, that simply suction to your shower wall. Once you have applied soap, you just rub your back side to side or up and down, to get a thorough back cleanse/exfoliation, removing the dead skin and leaving you feel refreshed. You can also suction it to your shower floor for a thourough foot cleanse/exfoliation, taking all the back and arm work out of cleaning your feet and back. It is a revolutionary hygiene product.My partner auditioned for the Australian Shark Tank but was knocked back, a couple of years ago. We have been selling them at markets, door to door, etc. We suspected and have proven the product will sell. i am approaching your company, as we would like you to consider buying the product off us, as you obviously have the marketing clout that we lack. We are convinced it would be a great opportunity for your company to expand into the hygiene market. Simply put, we have a good product that we lack the marketing skills for and are offering you the opportunity to buy it and take it to the next level with your marketing prowess. I believe their is potentially a good synergy with this product and your range. 
I hope whoever reads this passes it on to the appropriate person for consideration. 
I appreciate any time and consideration into this matter.
Kind Regards,
Con Christopoulos
(a.k.a.-Greek Lightning)

1) What is the Eraser portion EraserDaddy composed of? 
2) Are there toxins in the eraser portion of the Eraser? Specifically, are the fibers used in its composition toxic? Also, are toxic cleaning chemicals embedded in

5) There is no indication on labeling of  ‘ingredients’ used in composition of either scrub or eraser portions of product. Please state materials/ingredients.
Thank you.

fields.name: Michael Breitenstein
fields.comments:
Hi there , I love the concept and yes it does seem to scrub and foam really well.
However I noticed that the scrubbing part of the sponge deteriorates very quickly and shockingly fast ( about 3 week of regular use mostly with hot or warm water and a normal biodegradable soap) My concern is that the polymer plastic deteriorates into tiny pieces which are then flushed into the drain and i know for a fact that most waste water plants do not have the technology to filter out these tiny pieces of plastic   which in my case since I live by the ocean end up directly in the eco system of our ocean, this sponge seems to do this at a much faster rate then a cellulose sponge. I was hoping that you might offer a more environmentally friendly version .
I'll just keep using my cellulose based sponge until that time.

fields.name: Lisa Day
fields.comments: I bought my first scrub daddy sponge approximately 2-3 weeks ago at Stop & Shop grocery store. While it works very well it’s essentially disintegrating. I have photos to show ( I have four in total but I’m not sure they all uploaded). It’s just falling apart if I pull too hard it will break apart. I don’t know if I’m not using it correctly but when I’m done using it,  I rinse it and squeeze it out and place it in the dish strainer to dry. For nearly $5.00, I expected it  last much longer. I live alone and I only cook for myself so it’s not used constantly. I’m a bit disappointed.

fields.name: Tanya
fields.comments: Hello.        I have always wanted to try your products.     But the price was a lot.      I saved up to by the scrub mommy     Scrub flip and wipe sponges.     And I have only been using my first one for just a week and it’s already like gone away! I thought it would be stronger and last longer        I’m totally disspointed.   Or maybe I got one that wasn’t made right! Idk.      I just feel after only one week.     It should look like it does.     :( totally disappointed and sad about this product.

fields.name: JAY SCHULMAN
fields.comments:
We have used sponge daddy since we 1st heard about it.  It WAS the best sponge as it lasted a long time and snapped right back into shape after use.  
I am assuming that you have changed how these are made.  They no longer snap back into snap and last no longer than a regular sponge that cost 1/2 the price.
We never minded paying more because of the quality.  We will no longer continue to do so.  Cheapening this product lost you a customer and I am sure it has cost many more.
Jay Schulman
249 Williams Rd
Bryn Mawr, PA 19010

fields.name: johanna fonseca
fields.comments:
First and foremost, I wanted to say that we are big fans ever since we first saw you on shark tank. We have been using S.D. as our only sponge at home. When people come over, we convert them to believers. Weve tried Scrub Mommy but didnt like it as much.
Well, we just brought another multipack of Scrub Daddy from Bed Bath and Beyond. One sponge can last us 5-6 weeks of constant use. This one that we just brought lasted us 8 days of use over a 14 day period. It is already falling apart and has a smell. My family and I were shocked. This is not common for our favorite sponges! We didnt know if we just had a bad one or if manufacturing has been changed. We will see how the other ones in the pack are and we hope that the others last as long as they do. The green one is the one that we have had out for just about 2 weeks, and the orange one is the new one that we are trying out.

fields.name: johanna fonseca
fields.comments:
My family and I have only been using scrub daddies since we first heard about it on Shark Tank. We have converted our close friends and family to buy them as well. A sponge will usually last us 4-5 weeks. This is why we were shocked that our current sponge is beginning to break apart after only 8 days of use. We were wondering if maybe it was just a bad one or if the quality is going down. (which we hope isn't the case).  The green one is the one we have been using for 8 days and the orange one is a brand new one. 
Thank you for listening.

fields.name: Sue Berres
fields.comments: Your online store isn’t working.  Can you buy the Soap Daddy alone.  QVC is just a package.  If so how much is it and where can you buy it.  Can you buy it directly from you.

fields.name: Mary Johnson
fields.comments: I WAS a big fan of the scrub daddy sponges but lately the scrub side has not been lasting that long.  I get small pieces all over the place.  Not happy about that.  I didn't have that problem at the start.  I will be going back to the ones I used before.

I have a couple more from the same package that I have not yet used.  Could there be any reason for this quick deterioration?    Many thanks!

fields.comments: I have used scrubdaddy spunges for about 2 years and love them! However, I have had issues with the last package I bought. I absolutely love your product but wont continue to buy if this continues. Please help!

fields.name: Kathryn Hill
fields.comments:
I have been using Scrub Daddy since it was first sold in Bed, Bath & Beyond. I have always been very satisfied by the ease of use and the fact that it really scrubbed and each one lasted a long time.
However, I've noticed that the last two times I purchased packages of three they started falling apart quite soon after I started using them, so into the trash they went much sooner than they used to. 
Have you altered the contents or manufacturing process? I'm puzzled that something so satisfactory that lasted such a long time seems to become less useful and wears out more quickly that it used to. I would appreciate your comments about this puzzling situation.
Sincerely,
Kathryn Hill
Fairport, NY

In just a few weeks, I am looking to throw away my SECOND Mommy and already move on to my THIRD, knowing full well that this last one will most likely quickly disintegrate just as quickly as the first two :(

fields.name: Kathy White
fields.comments:
Good afternoon.  First, I wanted to say, I have used and been a fan since I saw your product on Shark Tank.  But I recently purchased your Sponge Daddy product and I couldn’t be more disappointed and concerned.  This product started falling apart after only 1 week of use and after 2 weeks has even less of the blue scouring side left.  I promise, this is only after normal usage.  Not used on grated or grilled dishes.  Only plates and glasses.  

This brings me to my concern.  Where are all the little blue pieces going?  Are they possibly remaining on my dishes for me to eat later?? I see some in the bottom of the sink, but there seems like there should be more than I am seeing.

I have included pictures of the sponge at 1 and 2 weeks.  What a disappointment.  Makes me concerned for the original Scrub Daddy product and its quality now also.  Have you started going cheaper on your cost to make your products in an effort to make more money?  Because I feel like this is the cheapest sponge I have ever purchase and is basically useless.

Sincerely,
Kathy

fields.name: Aching Hands
fields.comments:
I have just used your products:  Scrub and Scour daddy & mommy.
They do get the job done well.  
HOWEVER... the one thing that will stop me from purchasing again are the following reasons:
I spend time and money already on lotions to keep my hands, "fingertips" and nails...moisturized, healthy, manicured and professional.  That alone is a challenge, especially throughout the winter part of the year.   Put your product on a handle!!!  I don't need my fingertips and nails to be part of the SCRUB and SCOUR process!
Currently they are...and so...I will return to the brush on a long handle that keeps my hands away from the cleaning process...even though it may not be as affective as your products ... at least it will not ruin my 
hands.  I don't want to have to wear rubber gloves every time I have to do a quick clean up job int he kitchen sink.
I hope this helps and spurs you on to make a:
long handled, sanitary, scrub wand that will be a welcome item to pick up and use multiple times per day.
Clean my kitchen wares but save my hands!
Thank you for your consideration.

fields.comments: I purchased a 10 pc. set of Scrub Daddy products from QVC.  It included Scrub Daddy, Scrub Mommy, Scour, soap dispenser and caddy.  I loved all the products (especially the lemon/lime scent.)  However, after using the Scrub Daddy for 1 week, I put it in the top rack of my dishwasher with a light wash cycle.  I also washed a Scour pad.  The pad came out fine, but the Scrub Daddy changed shape and fall apart within 2 days.  I know I can return the entire 10 piece set to QVC, but I really like the products and thought this 1 sponge that fell apart was defective.  QVC advertised that each sponge was supposed to last 2 months and was dishwasher safe.

fields.name: Marie Cantanucci
fields.comments: Good Afternoon. I am writing you today to share my feedback with a Scrub Mommy that I purchased at my local Target. I have had it for a little over 2 weeks. I am very disappointed with this product. The pink scrub side started deteriorating after only using it a few times. Little pink parts come off daily. I expected a higher quality for what I paid for 1 sponge.  I would not recommend this product and I would not purchase it again if this is how all products are. I am hoping that maybe I purchased a bad one. I want to love this product and I do not normally take the time to write in feedback to companies but thought that you should know what happened to my Scrub Mommy. I appreciate your time and I look forward to hearing back from you.

fields.name: Lani weiss
fields.comments:
I have an invention with a provisional patent & a prototype that i would like help selling. We have a mutual friend & he informed me that you are looking for inventors to invest with. Please help 
Thank you, sincerely lani weiss

fields.comments:
I bought a new soap dispenser at the Philadelphia flower show. It leaked all the soap out through the bottom part of the dispenser. I love scrub daddy and buy lots of different things (at Bed bath and beyond).
The dual soap dispenser is not designed well.

I only wash dishes for two people and we eat out a lot, so maybe this was a bad badge.

fields.comments: I ordered a set of scrub daddy products from QVC. The caddy will not stick to my stainless steel sink. If I can get it to stick, it only stays for a couple of hours and then falls into the sink. What can I try to remedy this situation?

fields.name: Lisa Reynolds
fields.comments: I am taking managerial accounting and have this project. I chose this company because what you make and sell is awesome, I own a few and they work great! Anyways, I was wondering if there is anyway you’d give me any financial info? Like operating income. I need to make a contribution income statement. I can’t find any online info besides that it takes $1.00 to make a sponge and sell if for $2.80. Any information would be greatly appreciated. Please.

fields.name: Emma Gates
fields.comments: Hello! I love your products very much and was wondering if it was possible to be sent some of your stickers. Thank you for reading this email.

fields.name: K
fields.comments:
Scrub Daddy 
Oh dear! I love your product and tell everyone about it. It’s simple, works great, and cheers the kitchen or makes cleaning more pleasant. 
However... today I noticed little pieces of the smiley crumbling off. Now it dawns on me that this material is heading for the ocean, and once there, into some fish, and after that, into our bodies. Oh dear. 
Please tell me you are considering how you can improve your product by making it safer for us and the environment we live in. I don’t want to have to drop this product from my world—but I also don’t want to eat it. We already have plenty of plastic particles in our bodies as it is! 
Thank you. 
—K.

fields.name: Adina Henderson
fields.comments: I absolutely love your sponges. I saw you aire on sharktank and went out the next day to try THE SCRUB DADDY! I have bought many of these as gifts, an odd gift I know but such a good one! I have now begun to transition to being as earth friendly as possible which puts a hold on buying scrub daddy. Me and many other of your customers would love a earth conscious sponge, made of earth friendly products that will decompose or biodegrade in the long run. I hope your working on this! You are a great company, and I hope to be able to get an earth friendly sponge from you soon!

fields.comments: Hello. I am sending you a picture of my Scrub Daddy that I purchased three weeks ago. As you can see, it’s falling apart. I have purchased the Scrub Mommy x 2, and it may have held up just a little better. Is your product supposed to do this?!? I’m very disappointed.

fields.comments: hello, I'm Halie and I am writing this regarding to stickers. I was wondering if you could send me a few stickers for my hydro flask and laptop? my mailing address is 1589 hill view place #1102. thanks in advance! much love, halie

fields.name: Mike lekarczyk
fields.comments: Hello, I started using the sponge a week ago and it’s already starting to fall apart. Is there any way to resolve this?  Thank you

fields.name: Cori Williams
fields.comments:
Good Evening!
    We received our first scrub daddy about a year ago as a stocking stuffer and we loved it!  Since then we've been through our fair share of dish paraphernalia grabbing a new sponge here and there while making a quick grocery trip while at the moment realizing we needed a new sponge.  Scrub daddy never seemed to be an option while making an impulse buy at the local grocery store so we spent a year scrubbing dishes with generic sponge products.  After the holidays, I was in Bed Bath and Beyond returning a Christmas gift and I saw the huge display of Scrub Daddys (and Mommys!) and I had the Ah-Ha moment to stock up while I was there.  I was so excited to get home and get back to dish enjoyment, but I was shocked to see that the first sponge deteriorated almost completely just after 3 days.  I was shocked and even went back to look at the packaging to see if I bought the wrong one!  So, long story short, I sit here watching Shark Tank thinking of your product and am just let wondering what happened.  A product that was so great a year ago all of a sudden seems to be just like every other sponge on the market.  Just sharing my feedback, and hoping that perhaps I just got a crappy box.  Thanks for taking the time to listen to my concerns.  Best of luck in all you do!

Thanks,
Aly

fields.description: Big Daddy’s versatile design makes him the perfect cleaning tool for any job. Use him for large-scale scrubbing jobs like floors, siding, or a car. Made from exclusive FlexTexture® foam, he is scratch-free, texture changing, rinses clean and resists odors. Big Daddy works with water alone and has a customizable shape.
fields.title: Big Daddy  | Scrub Daddy Product Family

fields.description: Our Smiling Scrubbers make life easier. Best known for the shape of their yellow smiley face, our scrubbers are universal tools for your kitchen and bathroom cleanings. Based on the water temperature our sponge changes its texture - firm in cold water and soft in warm water - according to your cleaning needs.
fields.title: Get America’s Best Smiling Scrubber from Scrub Daddy today!

fields.description: Our growing product line now includes sponges, erasers and scouring pads - must-have cleaning tools for any household. Our products are made of high-quality materials and can be used on many surfaces. They are easily rinsed and don’t smell.
fields.title: Sponge Daddy, Eraser Daddy, Scour Daddy - your favorite cleaning tools!

fields.description: When looking for the best kitchen soap dispensing dishwand for your kitchen, look no further than the Scrub Daisy Dishwand System. Interchangeable scrubbing heads make Daisy the best tool for any job including baby bottles. A vase inspired holder keeps your counter dry while providing storage for your scrub brush.
fields.title: Get Scrub Daisy Dishwand System from Scrub Daddy

fields.description: Can’t find the right solution to store your favorite products? Daddy Caddy and Sponge Caddy are what you need. Our sink accessories are made with high-quality materials and simple design, perfectly fitting into any kitchen interior. Screen Daddy is a remedy for your smeared cell phone and tablet screens, eyeglasses, compact mirrors, etc.
fields.title: 3 items you must have: Daddy Caddy, Sponge Caddy, and Screen Daddy

fields.description: Daddy Caddy is the smart storage solution for your smile face scrubbers! Two large suction cups hold the caddy to any clean smooth surface. Daddy Caddy is top rack dishwasher safe; its open-air design allows draining and drying. Keep your Scrub Mommy or Daddy within arms’ reach yet out of the way.
fields.title: Daddy Caddy  | Scrub Daddy Product Family

fields.description: Eraser Daddy is our ergonomic dual-sided household eraser. His FlexTexture® scrubbing side removes debris while also creating a barrier to finger pressure. Flip to the water-activated PowErase® side and wipe away stains, fingerprints or dirt in seconds. Color-code your erasers easily with 4 vibrant shades.
fields.title: Eraser Daddy  | Scrub Daddy Product Family

fields.description: Our Scour Daddy is stronger and more durable than the competition. Scratch-free technology promises a worry-free cleaning experience. Under his ArmorTec® mesh is a FlexTexture® core which resists odors and changes texture based on water temperature. Scour Daddy comes in a variety of colors and with a removable loop.
fields.title: Scour Daddy  | Scrub Daddy Product Family

fields.description: Made from safe microfiber, Screen Daddy Colors rid your phone of dust, grease and fingerprints in seconds. Stick Screen Daddy directly on your device using the sticky backing so he’s always within reach! Screen Daddy is reusable, washable, and scratch-free. Perfect for tablets, phones, laptops, glasses, and displays.
fields.title: Screen Daddy Colors  | Scrub Daddy Product Family

fields.description: If you’re tired of smudges on your phone screen, Screen Daddy is just what you need. This small microfiber pad is scratch-free, washable and reusable! Use your index finger to wipe Screen Daddy across any glass surface, then store him directly on your device with a sticky silicone gel back on Screen Daddy’s reverse.
fields.title: Screen Daddy  | Scrub Daddy Product Family

fields.description: Scrub Daddy Colors do an amazing job of scrubbing every surface in your bathroom, kitchen and beyond! Assign each color to a different job and enjoy the scratch-free, texture changing benefits of our FlexTexture® foam. Place your fingers in the eyes for 360 degree scrubbing and use the mouth to wipe utensils clean.
fields.title: Scrub Daddy Colors  | Scrub Daddy Product Family

fields.description: If you like your sponges to come with a nice scent, then our Scrub Daddy Lemon Fresh is the perfect option for you. This scratch-free sponge will get your house clean while you enjoy a fresh lemon aroma. Scrub Daddy is made from FlexTexture® foam that changes texture based on water temperature and resists all odors!
fields.title: Scrub Daddy Lemon Fresh  | Scrub Daddy Product Family

fields.description: The Original Scrub Daddy is made from a unique material called  FlexTexture® which changes texture based on water temperature. This exclusive property makes it able to effectively handle light or tough cleaning jobs. Add some water and watch our scratch-free, odor resistant and non-toxic scrubber get the job done fast!
fields.title: The Original Scrub Daddy | Scrub Daddy Product Family

fields.description: Scrub Daisy can handle any job thanks to a variety of unique cleaning heads. Scrub Daisy is scratch-free, odor resistant, texture changing, and top rack dishwasher safe. Use the Hyacinth Glass & Bottle Scrubber, the Sunflower Pot & Pan Scourer, and the Daisy Multi-Purpose Scrubber for items of any size and shape.
fields.title: Scrub Daisy  | Scrub Daddy Product Family

fields.description: Scrub Mommy is one of the most popular products in the Scrub Daddy family because of her unique dual-sided design. One half is texture-changing scratch-free FlexTexture® foam perfect for light or heavy scrubbing. The other half is made from ResoFoam®, our suds-generating material that stays velvety soft even when dry.
fields.title: Scrub Mommy  | Scrub Daddy Product Family

fields.description: Don’t let the traditional shape fool you, this is not an ordinary sponge - Sponge Daddy’s FlexTexture® half becomes firm in cold water and soft in warm water, allowing him to handle virtually any mess. His ResoFoam® half is suds-generating, stain and odor resistant, and super absorbent. Say goodbye to stinky sponges!
fields.title: Sponge Daddy  | Scrub Daddy Product Family
SpongeBob - Special Edition Scrubber and Cleaning Pad!

fields.description: We at Scrub Daddy have an assortment of high-quality cleaning products available, including smiling scrubbers, sponges, erasers, accessories, and our original Scrub Daisy Dishwand system. Our multi-use cleaning items will do wonders to your home!

fields.title: Meet the Scrub Daddy Product Family | Smiling Scrubbers, Sponges, Erasers, & More

fields.description: Scrub Daddy is one of the most popular sponge manufacturers in the US. Starting out with our classic Scrub Daddy, we’ve since expanded our line of products to include an extensive list of dual-sided sponges, heavy-duty scrubbers, durable scour pads, erasers, dishwands and accessories.
fields.keywords: Scrub Daddy, dual-sided sponge, heavy-duty scrubber, durable scour pad, eraser
fields.title: About Us | Scrub Daddy | America’s Best Sponge Company

fields.description: Scrub Daddy’s history begins with our founder Aaron Krause’s appearance on the popular ABC show Shark Tank. Since then, we’ve been invited to tell our story and share our ever-growing product family across various forms of media. Be sure to check them out along with some interesting publications to learn more about our journey!

fields.description: We at Scrub Daddy know all the secrets of efficient cleaning and we’ll be glad to share them with you. Our blog will keep you updated on the latest news in the world of cleaning. Learn everything about the latest tools and gadgets that can assist in ridding your home of dirt, debris, and dust.

fields.description: Scrub Daddy is more than just a sponge company! Explore new ways to use our products and find answers to common questions. We want you to join our list of satisfied customers; if you still harbor doubts be sure to review our extensive list of FAQs and contact us with questions.

fields.description: Scrub Daddy has joined forces with major retailers across the country like Bed Bath & Beyond, Target, Home Depot and more!  Discover where you can buy our happy high-quality sponges, scrubbers, scour pads, erasers and other cleaning tools near you.

Our exclusive FlexTexture® and functional smiley face design revolutionizes house cleaning. Keep your home spotless with the best products from the number 1 selling scrub sponge brand in America!
fields.title: Scrub Daddy – America's Favorite Sponge

Dual-suction cups keep the caddy securely in place, allowing it to hold several regular sponges or one Smile Face Sponge. Open air design promotes draining and drying.
